pull.title: Rework same-chain from abusing DoS banning, to explicit checks
pull.body: This fixes bugs where we end up banning peers running different consensus rules (including old nodes following a softfork). Since we rely on having peers enforcing the same rules as us, it also enforces that outbound non-feeler connections must have and maintain the same tip block; if they diverge from us, we disconnect them (and find a replacement).

events.message: validation: Combine all 3 block-invalidation logics into one function
Bugfix: Exclude known-invalid blocks from pindexBestHeader
Bugfix: Do not DoS-ban for invalid prev block, since old nodes may forward such in the event of a softfork
Bugfix: Don't ban peers just because they have header chains we consider invalid

events.body: bleh please don't use reject for this.
@gmaxwell Do you have a better solution? It doesn't seem like we have any other way to determine that case?

events.message: Require outbound non-feeler connections use the same tip block as us
If an outbound-and-not-feeler peer rejects a block we send them, they presumably are on a different tip, and therefore we disconnect them
net: Tolerate unmatching tips on whitelisted and addnode'd peers

events.body:
This breaks because compact blocks allows relaying invalid blocks without penalty, but there is no indication at all even later, whether the peer sending you the compact block has accepted it himself or not... so basically we can almost never know if a compact-block peer is on a different tip than us.

Ideas for how to solve this?
Closed due to impracticality, and superceded by #10593
